111.content:
“Dakota, come meet your babysitter,” Dakota’s stepdad said.

Twelve-year-old Dakota looked up glumly from his comic book. The book was normal-sized, while Dakota was a Shrinky, just under six inches tall, so it spread out in front of him like a large blanket. He rested an elbow on the page he was reading and stared at his stepdad, who stood in the doorway of Dakota’s bedroom.

“I don’t want to,” Dakota said. “Just have him check on me every half hour like the other ones do. I’ll be fine.”

Dakota’s stepdad folded his arms and frowned at him. Feeling uncomfortable Dakota looked down at the page beneath him again. Dakota’s stepdad was only twenty-five. He had married Dakota’s mom last year, despite the fact that she was thirty-two. Dakota’s relationship with his stepdad had never been good. Neither of them liked one another. Dakota called him by his first name, Avery.

Although truthfully, Dakota had not gotten along with his biological mother very well either. She seemed to resent having to care for him, and when he developed the Shrinking Syndrome, she appeared even more annoyed at the time she needed to devote to him. She died in a car wreck at the end of last year. Dakota was not nearly as saddened by her death as he expected. Now it was only Dakota and his stepdad, and things were always tense between them.

“Come on, I told him I’d introduce you,” Dakota’s stepdad said in an annoyed tone.

“Fine,” Dakota said unhappily.

Sighing, Dakota slowly stood. The mattress of his normal size bed made it difficult for him to move very fast. He trudged toward the foot of the bed.

Who is Dakota's babysitter?

1111.content:
Meanwhile, downstairs, nineteen-year-old Tanner waited in the kitchen with his hands in the pockets of his jeans, rocking back and forth on his heels and studying the sparsely decorated living room he stood in. With old, hand-me-down furniture, no wall decorations, and an adjoining kitchen with an overflowing trashcan and a sink piled high with dishes, the house looked more like a college kid’s apartment than a father’s home. This fact was not surprising, considering the father of the boy he would be babysitting was only six years older than Tanner, and still in college. Tanner had just enrolled in college himself, and he did not mind the mess in this house. In fact, he felt right at home.

To his left the staircase creaked as the man of the house descended, carrying a shrunken boy in his hand. The man was handsome but scraggly and somewhat lanky. He walked across the living room and stood in front of Tanner, holding out his hand.

“Tanner, meet my stepson Dakota. Dakota, meet Tanner.”

Tanner grinned delightedly when he saw how cute the shrunken boy was. Dakota’s delicate face was boyishly handsome, with blue eyes and light-brown hair. His fair-skinned calves were shown off well by the khaki shorts he wore, and his T-shirt hugged an upper body that appeared toned for a boy his age. Tanner felt himself growing aroused in his loins. After all, he had not taken this job for the money.

“Hi Dakota. Nice to meet you,” Tanner said.

“Hi,” Dakota said in a bored tone.

“Well, I’ve got to go,” Dakota’s stepfather said. “I’ll be back late tonight. Just check on him every thirty minutes or so to make sure he’s okay and see if he needs anything. He can’t get in to too much trouble, since he can’t get very far on his own.” He chuckled.

“Ha, I understand,” Tanner said with his own chuckle.

Dakota eyed the older teen in front of him briefly. Tanner was handsome,
with shaggy brown hair, brown eyes, tan skin, toned arms and a muscular torso. Dakota did not care though. He just wanted to get away from both his stepdad and his babysitter and back to his comic book.

His wish was granted seconds later, when his stepdad turned and climbed the stairs once more.

“Bye,” his stepdad said quickly, after placing Dakota on his bed again.

“Uh-huh,” Dakota mumbled, not really caring.

His stepdad left, shutting the door behind him.

Dakota flopped onto his back with his hands behind his head and stared at the ceiling. He knew he was not that different from most other twelve-year-olds. He enjoyed sports, movies, comic books and eating. He was just beginning to discover girls. But unlike other boys his age, he was a Shrinky. Dakota had always prized himself on his ability to take care of himself, and on his indifference to his mother’s uncaring attitude towards him. But since the day he shrank, discouragement began to overwhelm him. He knew he would never be treated like a normal person again.

Pushing such thoughts out of his mind, he crawled to his comic book and resumed reading.

After a while, he decided he wanted a snack while he read. He stood and walked to the side of his bed. A toy racecar track bridged the gap between the mattress and his long dresser. His stepdad had made very little adjustments for Dakota’s new life as a Shrinky, but he had at least made a few accommodations, and the racetracks placed around Dakota’s room were one of those. He walked up the steady incline of the racetrack to his dresser, then over to an overturned jar of bite-size candy bars. Well, bite-size for anyone who was not a Shrinky. Dakota dragged a bar of chocolate bigger than his head out of the jar, unwrapped it like opening a birthday present, and broke off a chunk. He slid back down the racetrack like it was a slide and leapt to his feet once they touched the mattress again. He munched on his candy bar and lost himself in the world of his comic book.

“Everything okay up here?” a giant’s voice asked, startling Dakota.

He gasped and rolled over. Tanner stood in the room’s doorway.

“Y-yeah I’m fine,” Dakota said. “Knock next time, okay?” he added crossly.

Tanner did not answer. Instead, he walked across the room to the bed. Dakota felt and heard the heavy thumping of his shoes on the floor. He stood by the side of the bed, looming over Dakota and staring down at him with a weak, crooked grin.

“What are you reading?” Tanner asked.

“A comic book,” Dakota answered grumpily.

Tanner bent over the book and smoothed the page down with his index finger.

“Hmm. Spiderman. Good choice,” Tanner remarked, winking at Dakota.
Dakota folded his arms and glared at the giant teen, waiting for him to leave.

But Tanner’s hand suddenly flew off the book and wrapped its fingers around Dakota, lifting him swiftly into the air.

“Hey! Put me down!” Dakota squealed.

“I’ve never seen a Shrinky up close before,” Tanner said. He opened his fingers, causing Dakota to sit in his palm. He began poking and petting Dakota with his other hand. “You’re so cool, a miniature person.”

“Stop it! Put me back on the bed!” Dakota yelled, punching and shoving at Tanner’s fingers.

What happens next?

Exactly an hour after Dakota’s bedroom door shut behind Tanner, his door swung open again. Tanner stood in the doorway, grinning, hefting a glass jar in his palm.

Dakota had been sitting on his bed, rocking to and fro, unable to think of a way to get help from anyone outside his house. Now that Tanner had returned with a mischievous grin on his face, Dakota’s fears surged to new heights.

“It’s time for bed,” Tanner said.

“Okay,” Dakota said hurriedly. “I’ll go to sleep now. Good night.”

“I thought we’d play a game first, though,” Tanner said. “Little boys like games, right?”

Tanner stepped into the room. Dakota stood and began backing away.

“See, the talk shows and news commentators are starting to say that Shrinkies are nothing more than pets, like insignificant bugs,” Tanner said. “So I figure, let’s see if they’re right.”

He held up the jar.

“If I can’t capture you with this jar in five minutes, then you win and you get to go to bed,” he continued. “But if I catch you with it, I can treat you like the bug you are and do whatever I want with you.”

Dakota’s stomach twisted in fear. “No! I don’t like that game at all!” he shouted. “I don’t want to play it!”

Ignoring him, Tanner held his wristwatch up to his face. “To be fair, I’ll give you a thirty second head start, and I won’t even watch you to see where you hide. And...go!”

“No, no, no!” Dakota panted frantically.

But Tanner was staring at his watch intently, legs poised to spring into action any moment. Seeing this, Dakota turned and ran with all his might across the bed, heart racing in his chest.

He sprinted up the only race track that still touched his bed. It led to his long dresser, where stacks of books and textbooks lined its top. He dove behind the nearest stack.

“Time’s up, here I come!” announced Tanner. “I bet I know where you tried to hide.”

Dakota heard and felt Tanner tromp over to the dresser. He pressed his back against the rough pages of the book behind him, chest heaving in terror.

“Which books are you behind?” Tanner sang, tugging on the pile next to Dakota. It toppled off the dresser to the bedroom floor loudly, causing Dakota to gasp in fright.

“I’m going to find you, little bug,” Tanner said. “You can’t escape me little Shrinky.” He chuckled to himself.

He shoved Dakota’s overturned jar of candy bars roughly against the wall. His hand swooped back across the dresser and grabbed a stack of comic books in front of Dakota and lifted them off the dresser. Panicking, Dakota darted from his hiding spot toward another stack of books. He threw himself down behind it and crept to its corner, peering rapidly in both directions, trying to see which way Tanner would come from, either from where the comic books had been, or in front of the dresser where Tanner stood. He saw the mountain of Tanner’s body shift along the front of the dresser, so he shifted behind the stack of books.

Tanner’s hand suddenly dropped to the dresser beside the stack of books. Using his forefinger and middle finger, Tanner began walking his hand around on the dresser top, first left, then right, then left again. Dakota’s pulse raced in fear.

Five minutes, he thought. I only have to hide from him for five minutes.

Suddenly the stack of books dropped away from him and crashed to the floor far below. Dakota teetered, flailing his arms to keep from following the books off the dresser. He spun around to see Tanner staring directly at him.

He yelped and ran in the opposite direction with all his might.

“Gotcha!” Tanner crowed triumphantly.

“No!” Dakota squeaked helplessly as the glass jar slammed down around him in mid run. He bounced off the curved wall and landed on
his bottom.

Through the glass he watched Tanner’s giant face, warped slightly by the jar, lower toward him, grinning happily. Seconds later the jar leapt upward and a giant hand replaced it, wrapping its fingers around Dakota and lifting him off the dresser.

“Put me down!” Dakota shouted, wriggling in Tanner’s fist.

“Ha-ha! Thought you could get away, huh? I don’t think so,” Tanner said smugly. “I win.”

Using his other hand, Tanner pinched Dakota’s shrunken hands between forefinger and thumb and lifted him out of his fist. He dangled Dakota in front of his face, grinning, watching delightedly as Dakota’s legs swung through empty air while Dakota twisted and struggled.

“You’re so tiny. I love it!” Tanner laughed. “It’s like, look at your little legs go!”

“Put me down!” Dakota repeated. He was terrified by how far below him the carpeted floor waited.

Dakota was startled from his fearful gazing at the floor when Tanner’s giant forefinger from his other hand poked him in the stomach. That forefinger rubbed his stomach, then moved up to rub his chest.

“Cut it out! What are you doing?” Dakota demanded.

He looked at Tanner’s huge, handsome face. The giant teen stared intently at Dakota’s body, not at Dakota’s face, with a crooked, amused grin.

“Feels like you’ve got quite the physique,” Tanner remarked.

He dropped Dakota into his palm again.

Tanner turned and walked out of the room. Dakota fell onto his bottom while the hand beneath him lurched and swayed with each of Tanner’s steps. Tanner carried him down the hallway and into the kitchen.

Sitting at the kitchen table, Tanner tilted his hand toward the table’s surface, causing Dakota to roll of his hand and onto the tabletop. Dakota grunted angrily and scrambled to his feet. His left foot crunched on a chunk of toast crumbs. He looked down and saw jelly and mustard stains on the red and white checkered tablecloth.

Night blanketed the kitchen. The overhead electric light cast artificial yellow light onto Tanner’s leering face.

“What are you doing?” Dakota questioned.

“I won the game, so now I get to play with you however I want to,” Tanner answered.

The backpack swung around until it was sitting in Brandon’s lap. Alec felt like his stomach got left behind for a few moments. Giant fingers fished Alec out of the net pocket, lifted him up to Brandon’s face, and spun him around.
Brandon did not say anything, but Alec quickly figured out what had caught the giant teen’s attention.

On the corner of the street, where Brandon straddled his bike, in front of a simple, blue two-story house, stood a large poster board taped to a wooden post in the front yard. On the poster board, in large black typeface, the following words were printed:

Shrinky Boy Petting Zoo
$50 for Fifteen Minutes with the Shrinkies!
Come One Come All!
Open 7am to 9pm

Even as Alec watched, a teenage boy strode up to the front door, knocked, and was immediately allowed inside by a young man, who shut the door quickly behind the boy.

“That’s....really messed up!” Alec said. “I can’t believe that.”

“I’ve seen Shrinky petting zoos before,” Brandon admitted. “Just never one so...homespun.”

“It’s tacky and white-trash looking,” Alec said disgustedly. “And wrong!”

“Well, I would have disagreed with you a few weeks ago,” Brandon said. “But now..." He turned his hand so Alec faced him and touched Alec’s chest lightly. “Now, I realize Shrinkies are more than just pets,” he finished.

“Really?” Alec asked. “So you don’t think of me as your pet anymore?”

Brandon smiled. “More like my pet boyfriend,” he chuckled.

Alec felt his face redden, but in embarrassment, not shame, which surprised him. The Alec from a few weeks ago would have definitely felt ashamed of being in a relationship with another boy. Now, Alec’s feelings for Brandon erased all that.

“Silly giant Brandon,” Alec teased.

Brandon laughed. He lifted Alec to his lips and kissed him, sending saliva oozing down Alec’s chest and stomach.

“Seriously though, we have to help those Shrinkies in there!” Alec said, twisting in Brandon’s hand and pointing toward the house.

“Help them? What do you want me to do?” Brandon asked.

“Free them!”

Brandon shook his head. “That would be stealing.”

“They aren’t property! They’re human beings!” Alec shouted. “Besides, you stole me from your teacher!”

“Okay, okay,” Brandon said soothingly. “I agree. But there’s no way I could do it without getting caught.”

Alec tried to think of an argument to that statement, but could not. He frowned at the ground far, far below him.

Suddenly Brandon’s forefinger from his free hand tapped Alec’s chin and lifted Alec’s face up to stare at Brandon.

“Not during the day anyway, and not by walking through the front door,” Brandon said, a weak smile on his face. “But it looks like that second story window has curtains, not blinds. There might be a way.”

Alec felt his forehead wrinkle in confusion. “Huh?”

Brandon’s dazzling eyes glittered. “I’ve got an idea.”
1121111111111111111111.title: Brandon discovers more Shrinkies

Ernle steals Alec while Brandon wasn't looking
11211111111111111111111.content:
“Wow, I didn’t know you had your own pet Shrinky!” exclaimed the bespectacled giant boy in wonder.

He plucked Alec off of Brandon’s palm and lifted him up to his face for examination. Alec had gotten comfortable with Brandon seeing him naked, but under the scrutinizing gaze of this new giant, he covered his privates with his hands shyly. The giant blond boy’s face filled Alec’s vision as his giant finger traced the muscles in Alec’s chest and stomach.

“Found him during last semester,” Brandon said. “And like I told you over the phone, I need your help rescuing some more Shrinkies.”

“Can I keep some of them?” the blond boy asked eagerly. His forefinger nudged Alec’s hands aside and poked Alec’s penis.

“Hey! Don’t!” Alec squealed.

“Don’t touch his fellas,” Brandon said in a friendly but firm tone. “And no, you can’t keep them. We’re freeing them, not stealing them, Ernle.”

“If you say so,” the blond boy, Ernle, said. But he pulled his finger quickly out from between Alec’s legs. “Anyway, it’s the least I can do,” Ernle continued, straightening his glasses on his petite nose. “I owe you for protecting me from the other jocks all the time.”

“No sweat,” Brandon said. “So, let’s get this plan rolling.”

“Okay,” Ernle said.

He handed Alec back to Brandon, then turned and walked across the cramped basement. Boxes, tables, and old
couches covered the floor, and shelves lined the walls. Most of these shelves were occupied by foam and plastic model planes and helicopters, with motors and servos wired into them. There was even a model boat on one lower shelf. Ernle walked to a plastic helicopter and picked it up.

“I still can’t believe you build all these remote control toys yourself,” Brandon said, absently petting Alec, who nuzzled his finger while watching Ernle. Alec did not dislike the other boy, despite his recent violation of his privates, but he did not know whether to trust him either.

“I buy the remotes and motors online,” Ernle said humbly. “It’s not that hard. Anyway, this helicopter right here is store-bought model. And luckily it’s big enough on the inside for your plan to work.”

“Great,” Brandon said. “That just means I need to head back to the ‘petting zoo’ right before closing time.”
He lifted Alec up to his face. “You ready for this, silly Alec?”

“I don’t know,” Alec said. “I would say this was a great plan, except it hinges on me.”

“So? What’s your point?” Brandon asked.

Alec hung his head. “I just know I’m going to mess up. I...”

He stopped when he felt Brandon’s finger stroking the side of his face. He looked up into Brandon’s beautiful eyes and almost forgot where he was.

“Alec, I believe in you. It’s time you started believing in yourself too,” Brandon said.

Alec smiled weakly. “Okay,” he said. “Okay.”
..........
11211111111111111111111.title: Alec meets Brandon's friend

choices: Alec's rescue mission
Brandon shrunk, caught by Avery and becomes part of the petting zoo!
112111111111111111111111.content:
Brandon left his bike in the bushes that bordered the blue, two-story house’s front yard. He also left Alec crouching out of sight behind the bushes, next to his bike, bundled in winter Shrinky clothing that Brandon and Ernle had purchased for him earlier that afternoon.

“I’ll be back in a few minutes,” Brandon said. He looked down at Alec’s tiny face, which stared up at him with concern, and winked. “See you soon, little guy.”

“Right on,” Alec said.

Brandon strode up to the house’s front door, guided through the night by the house’s porch light. He zipped up his jacket against the chill night air. He stepped onto the house’s front step and rang the doorbell.
A few moments later, the door opened and a scraggly man in his twenties, with a lackadaisical expression on his face, poked his body out.

“Looks like you’re my last customer tonight. I’m Avery. Come on in,” he said.

Once inside the house’s entryway, with the front door closed behind him, Avery made Brandon pay right away. Then he asked him to leave his jacket in the living room.

“They’re in the upstairs room, first door on the right,” Avery said.

While climbing the staircase, Brandon was relieved that his first hunch was correct: The Shrinkies were being kept on the second story.

He entered the room and found a glass cage sitting on the floor in front of him, in the middle of an otherwise empty floor. The walls were also bare. He walked up to the cage, knelt in front of it, and peered inside.

Five nude, shrunken boys stared up at him. A lanky, yet handsome, boy, probably thirteen or fourteen, stared up at
Brandon with curiosity, while the other boys regarded him with sickened apprehension and fear. Two boys appeared to be close to the same age, probably eighteen or nineteen years old, and sat next to each other, one with dark brown hair, the other with blond hair. A dark-haired boy with facial features even more petite than Alec’s huddled in a corner of the cage, and a boy that could not have been older than twelve hugged his knees and stared hollowly up at Brandon.

“Hi guys,” Brandon said.

The boys stared at him, but said nothing at first. They seemed to be waiting for something. Probably for him to play with them, Brandon thought. When he simply stared back down at them, the lanky, curious one stepped forward.

“Aren’t you going to mess with us?” he asked.

Brandon grinned. “Nope. Not today. Actually,” and now he lowered his voice and leaned closer to the cage, “I’m here to rescue you guys.”

All five boys leapt to their feet.

“Rescue us?” questioned the older, blond teen. “How? Why?”

“Well, let’s just say it was my pet Shrinky’s idea,” Brandon chuckled.

“Oh great, we get to be someone else’s pet,” the blond teen said, rolling his eyes.

“Actually, more like my guests,” Brandon said. “I’ve had a change of heart the past few weeks. I’ll find a way to get you all home, if you want.”

“I don’t believe you, but you still have to get us out of here,” the dark-haired, older teen said. “I don’t think Avery will let you.”

“The guy who owns you?” Brandon asked. “Don’t worry, I’ve got a plan. But first I need to know something.” He checked over his shoulder, then lowered his voice further. “Does this Avery guy ever check this room’s window at night?”

The boys stared at him in confusion.

“Uh, no,” the preteen one answered. “Why?”

“Just be ready, when the time comes. Shouldn’t be more than an hour,” Brandon said with confidence.

He glanced toward the room’s doorway again, then crept over to the bedroom window which, thankfully, was covered by a set of curtains. He lifted the curtains quietly aside and, ever so gently so he did not make too much noise, pushed open the window a good seven or eight inches. Then he let the curtains fall quietly back into place.
He walked quickly over to the side of the cage once more.

“Are you really going to set us free?” asked the boy that had been huddling in the corner. Brandon felt a twinge of compassion at the hopeful, plaintive tone in his voice.

“Yep, trust me,” Brandon assured him.

The boys exchanged glances among themselves, then stared up at Brandon. None of them said anything. Judging from their shrunken facial expressions, none of them believed Brandon. Oh well, Brandon thought, they would see soon enough.

“Now, I’ve got to use up my full fifteen minutes or old Avery will get suspicious,” Brandon said. “Why don’t you tell me your names. Mine’s Brandon, by the way.”

“I’m Kensal,” said the lanky one. He had been the most bold and the least frightened one of the bunch, Brandon noticed.

“I’m Dakota.”

“I’m Clay.”

“Dylan.”

“My name’s James.”

“Nice to meet you guys,” Brandon said cheerfully. “So, let me tell you my plan...”

When Brandon picked up his jacket off the living room couch, he was surprised when Avery requested a pat-down
of his body. Glaring at the older man, he allowed him to briskly pat his pockets, butt, crotch, chest and stomach.

“You’re clean,” Avery said. “Thanks for coming.”

“Sure,” Brandon said, deciding that he did not like this man.

He stepped out into the chilly night, hearing the front door shut behind him almost immediately. Before he had taken five steps, the porch light winked out, leaving him in darkness.

“Nice guy,” Brandon hissed. But he was grateful for the cover the lack of light provided.

1121111111111111111111111.content:
Alec sat in the cockpit of the toy helicopter, snuggled in this Shrinky-sized jacket, shirt, pants, socks and shoes, with his stomach roiling in fear. The remote control for the helicopter lay in front of him, partially obscuring his view through the front window of the cockpit, and filling up half the cockpit itself. He could see every scrape and smudge on the remote’s dull brown gray surface, a remote the size of two kitchen stoves to him.

“I don’t know about this. I’m having second thoughts,” he called.

Brandon crouched in front of the helicopter, his giant face peering intently into the cockpit and lit only by distant streetlights and the waxing moon.

“Don’t worry, you’ll do fine,” Brandon said. “Besides, those boys in there are counting on you. Come on, silly Alec, remember, I believe in you.”

“Right,” Alec said, drawing confidence from those words. He took a deep breath. “Okay, let’s do this.”

With trembling hands, he pushed the switch in the center of the controller into the “on’ position, then pushed up on the left joystick.

Almost instantly, the helicopter whirred to life and lifted straight into the air. Alec gasped and clutched the plastic interior with his free hand as the toy sped through the air, past tree branches that reached out like clawed, mutated hands, to the waiting window on the second story. He had practiced flying the helicopter
for hours that afternoon, but fear still churned inside him when he contemplated how badly hurt he would be if he crashed.

Within moments, the helicopter plunged through the curtains in front of the window, scraping them and pushing them aside.

Alec’s pulse pounded in his ears as he stared at the darkened room before him. He could hardly see anything, and here he was flying a helicopter into that darkness. With his heartbeat and the buzz of the helicopter’s rotor blades singing in his ears, Alec guided the vehicle forward and downward with hands that still trembled.
..........
“That must be him!” Dylan hissed excitedly.

Dakota stared into the gloom of the lightless room excitedly. The other shrunken boys stood in a ring next to him, also staring upward. Because his eyes had already adjusted to the dark, Dakota could see a bulbous shape spiraling downward toward the cage.

“Look!” he shouted, pointing. “Right there!”

“I see it too!” cried James happily.

Dakota and the other boys leapt back as the object landed in their midst. Swirling air currents stirred his hair across his forehead and neck. He gazed at the silhouette of the object in front of him, an object that stood nearly twice his height. His mind began to make sense of it, slowly at first, then a landslide of recognition that transformed the silhouette into a helicopter, blades swooshing silently to a standstill.

With a click, the cockpit door on the right side, the side closest to Dakota, popped open. A brown-haired boy stuck his upper body out. He wore a Shrinky-sized jacket.

“Get in! Hurry!” Alec shouted.

At first Dakota and his fellow prisoners merely gaped at each other.
Moments later, it was a mad scramble to be the first into the toy helicopter.

“Watch it!”

“Ouch!”

“Hey! Careful!”

“Relax! I won’t take off without any of you!” Alec yelled, but his tone carried unmistakable meekness.

Now Dakota, James, Kensal, Dylan and Clay were jammed tightly together behind Alec, who stood in front of a remote control that lay against the front of the cockpit. The cockpit itself did not have any chairs, not even plastic replicas of ones, which was a good thing: Dakota and his companions were already squished tightly together, their nude bodies rubbing against each other in very awkward ways. Dakota, James, and Kensal squirmed uncomfortably. Dakota noted that Dylan and Clay did not seem to mind being this close at all.

With a push of one of the joysticks on the remote control from the new boy, the helicopter zipped off the cage floor and straight into the air.

Suddenly the room’s overhead light flicked on.

“Ah!” Alec cried out, and he was echoed by several of the other boys.

Dakota new instantly what was happening, and his blood felt like it chilled instantly.

“What the hell is going on up...” began the unmistakable voice of Avery. “Holy crap!”

Alec rotated the helicopter around until it was facing the room’s doorway, and there stood Avery, glaring at the hovering toy and its occupants.

“Oh no,” James breathed.

With a wordless snarl, Avery lunged toward them.

Dakota and his companions screamed, including the new boy. Fortunately, the new boy also directed the helicopter sharply to the right, speeding it toward the window. Its rotor blades bounced off the curtain and sent it careening in circles. Through the cockpit window, Dakota saw Avery grasping at them, his fingers regular inches away from snaring the helicopter. Dakota screamed louder in despair.

Then the toy helicopter whirled out of his reach, plummeted several regular feet through the air, before bobbing upward and sailing over the treetops.

Dakota breathed a sigh of relief. They had escaped.
..........
Alec knew that Brandon would not be behind the bushes anymore; he would be waiting for them at the designated meeting place. Alec flew the helicopter toward that spot, sweet relief coursing through him, his hands no longer trembling on the remote control.

Sure enough, Ernle’s bedroom window was open when Alec lowered the helicopter past the street sign that designated his street. Ernle lived on the corner of two streets that intersected only half a mile away from where Avery lived. Brandon, apparently, lived much farther away. Guiding the helicopter to the glowing window like a ship toward a lighthouse, Alec steered the toy through the window and into the warm, brightly lit bedroom inside.
He landed the helicopter on Ernle’s desk, blowing several loose post-it notes, rubber bands, and paper clips to the floor.

Smiling to himself, he waited for the boys nearest to the cockpit door to open it. But nothing happened. They all simply sat there, still crammed together like sardines.

“Uh, how about we get out of here?” Alec asked.

“Are you sure we can trust these new giants any more than Avery?” one of the boys asked.

Alec did not answer right away. “We can trust Brandon, the one you already met.”

“Right,” said a tall blond boy near the cockpit door. “Okay...here goes...”

He shoved open the door, and the boys stumbled out onto the desktop.

Instantly, Brandon’s hand grabbed Alec and whisked him up to his face. His lips planted a wet kiss on Alec’s face, drenching it. Alec laughed as Brandon proceeded to tickle his chin and armpits.

“Way to go, silly Alec, way to go,” Brandon said. “You saved the day!”

Reader's choice
11211111111111111111111111.content:
Alec giggled and smiled happily as Brandon set him down on the desk beside the other shrunken boys. He watched Brandon fold his arms and smile warmly down at Alec and the others.

Ernle stepped up beside Brandon and stared down excitedly at the boys.

“This is so cool. Look at all of them,” Ernle commented, his eyes flicking rapidly to and fro in their sockets, behind his eyeglasses. “A bunch of shrunken naked boys.”

Alec saw his companions shift uneasily and step back towards the helicopter.

“Easy Ernle, they’re not just pets or toys,, no matter what people say,” Brandon said.

“If you say so,” Ernle said, still gazing longingly at the boys behind Alec. Alec felt like his skin was crawling a little, but was grateful that at least Ernle’s stare was not directed at him.

“It’s Brandon, isn’t it?” one of the oldest boys asked, the brunette, stepping up beside Alec. He sounded intrigued.

“Yep, that’s me,” Brandon said.

“You’re different, from other giants I’ve met, I mean,” the older boy said. “In a good way.”

“Thank you,” Brandon said. “Maybe you all should introduce yourselves to Alec and Ernle.”

Alec turned to the boy standing beside him.

“I’m Clay,” the boy said.to Alec. “This is Dylan,” he added, pointing to the blond older teen.

“I’m Dakota.”

“I’m Kensal.”

“James.”

Alec noticed that only Kensal glanced at Ernle when he introduced himself.

“Nice to meet you,” Alec said.

“Thanks for saving us!” Dakota said. “Thank you so much!”

“No problem,” Alec said, beaming proudly. “I didn’t want to leave you in that ‘petting zoo.’”

“So, can’t help noticing you’ve got clothes,” Dylan said. “Any chance we could get some too?”

“Brandon just bought these for me today,” Alec said. “I didn’t...” he stopped himself before adding that he did not mind being naked around Brandon. Blushing, he looked away.

“I can’t afford even shorts for all of you,” Brandon said, “Sorry. I guess you’ll have to stay naked. It doesn’t seem fair to buy some of you clothes without getting them for everyone.”

Several of the boys behind Alec sighed unhappily.

“I guess you have a point,” Clay conceded grudgingly.

“I’ll make you some loincloths or something out of what I have lying around,” Brandon offered.

“Gee, sounds great,” James said sarcastically.

“Just being honest,” Brandon said, chuckling. “Anyway, I think it’s time I got home. My parents are going to wonder where I am, and Alec needs to call his mom.”

Alec sensed shifting and meaningful glances behind him, as the significance of Brandon’s statement sunk in.

“You mean, you’ll let us go home?” James asked. “You really aren’t going to keep us as pets?”

Brandon shook his head. “No, I’m not going to keep you. Like I said, little Alec here helped me see things differently. Besides, my parents would kill me they found out I was keeping six pet Shrinkies. I can’t afford to take care of you all!”

All the boys except James chuckled at this, including Alec.

Beaming at his giant friend, Alec approached the edge of the desk. Understanding instantly, Brandon held his hand, palm up, next to the desk. Alec stepped onto it. Brandon lifted him up to his face. Air rushed past Alec’s face as he ascended, a sensation he was growing more and more accustomed to. Brandon’s lips filled his vision as the giant teen gave him a quick peck on the face, sprinkling his head lightly with saliva. Brandon stroked his cheek lovingly.

“Hang on,” Brandon said, bending his thumb toward Alec.

Alec obeyed, gripping Brandon’s thumb with both arms and leaning on it.

Brandon lowered the hand holding Alec toward his pants pocket. With his free hand, he opened the pocket. Alec peered quickly inside before jumping off Brandon’s hand into the pocket. When Brandon released the pocket, it closed snugly around Alec. Alec snuggled in comfortably, his penis hardening in his new Shrinky pants as he felt Brandon’s warm, hard body behind him through Brandon’s clothes.

“Who’s next?” he heard Brandon ask.

He could see the bottom side of the desk from his current position in Brandon’s pocket, and watched as Brandon held his hand out next to it again. The next boy he lowered to the pocket was Dakota. The nude boy slipped in beside Alec, who tried to give the new boy some room, hoping he would not notice his erection. There really was not much room in the pocket, however, and by the time James dropped in beside the other two boys, they were rubbing shoulders, hips, and legs. Alec felt his face redden yet again.

“This is slightly awkward,” James muttered.

“Yes,” Dakota agreed.

Alec did not say anything.

112111111111111111111111111.content:
Kensal was now the last boy standing on the table. He looked at Brandon’s waiting hand, beckoning him. But his gaze was drawn once again to the boy standing behind Brandon.

Ernle’s inquisitive eyes stared longingly at Kensal from behind his eyeglasses, eyes filled with curiosity: A curious, giant, nerdy boy.

Kensal’s penis hardened and sprang to attention at the thought.

Brandon’s eyes widened. “Woah, looks like someone’s popping one off,” he said.

Kensal covered his penis with one hand, but was not too embarrassed about it.

“Actually, uh, Brandon,” Kensal began, “I think I’d like to...stay with Ernle.”

Brandon cocked an eyebrow. He glanced at Ernle, who shrugged. He looked back down at Kensal.

“Really?” Brandon asked.

“Yeah, I mean it,” Kensal assured him.

Ernle stepped up beside Brandon, who moved out of the way. Ernle’s petite yet giant face lowered toward Kensal, until it was so close that Kensal could feel the giant boy’s breath stirring the hairs on his head and could see his reflection in Ernle’s eyeglasses. The giant, nerdy teen appeared to be around Brandon’s age: fifteen or sixteen. Kensal’s heart pounded in his chest as he studied a huge face that he found alluring and attractive. He lowered his hand meaningfully, and Ernle’s eyes trained their gaze on his erect penis.

“You like to study stuff, right?” Kensal asked.

Ernle grimaced coyly. “Yeah.”

“How about you...study me?” Kensal asked, heart racing even faster. “It’ll be fun. I can be your pet and your science project!”

Ernle grinned maniacally. “That would be so sweet! Let’s do it!”

His fingers suddenly wrapped around Kensal and lifted him off the desk. Kensal relished the feeling of those warm fingers curled around his naked body. Ernle held him up to his face, opened his palm, and tilted it back. Following his lead, Kensal reclined against Ernle’s fingers, with his butt in Ernle’s palm. Ernle stared at him, smiling excitedly. He straightened his glasses, then glanced over at Brandon. Kensal looked at the other giant boy too.

“O-kay,” Brandon said awkwardly. “I guess, if that’s your choice, Kensal...” He stared down at his pockets. Kensal could not see them from his current position, but he knew that James, Dakota, and Alec were tucked into one, and Clay and Dylan sat in the other. “Unless any of you want to talk him out of it.”

“We don’t!” Kensal heard James call up snidely. “Goodbye Kensal! Been nice knowing you!”

Brandon shrugged.

“O-kay,” he said again, whistling.

….........

“There you go,” Brandon said, offering the last square piece of cloth he had cut out of a white rag to Dakota.

“Thanks,” Dakota said, taking it from Brandon’s fingers.

Brandon reclined in his office chair and observed the cluster of shrunken boys on his computer desk. Alec wore only his pants now, having stripped off his jacket, shirt and shoes because Brandon’s room was warm enough without them. Clay and Dylan stood close together, as usual, each with a white square piece of cloth tied around their waists like a short towel, or skirt, though Brandon had not told them about the second comparison like he had teased Alec a few weeks ago. James and Dakota were just finishing tying their own makeshift towels around themselves.

Brandon laid his hand on his computer mouse and clicked the thumbs-down symbol on his Pandora web page screen, since he did not like the current song. A refreshing, upbeat song began playing in its place, and he reclined in his chair again.

He was glad to be back home. The video game and sports posters covering his wall were comfortingly familiar. And this time, he had little Alec with him, which caused his heart to burn in strange new ways. He saw that Alec was still staring at him, so he winked at him. Alec smiled warmly.

After digging in his rear pocket, he lifted his cell phone out and set in on the desk next to the shrunken boys.

“Okay, Alec’s already made his phone call. Since it took, uh, forever, you all should have had plenty of time to decide who goes next,” Brandon said.

“Ah shut up,” Alec said sarcastically.

None of the other boys said anything. Clay and Dylan stared at each other meaningfully. Dakota was frowning sadly.

“Is everything okay?” Brandon asked.

“I don’t want to go home, but I don’t have anywhere else to go.” Dakota said pitifully. “I don’t know what to do!”

“We’re not going to call our families,” Clay said.

“You’re what?” Brandon asked incredulously.

“If we go back, they’ll just make us try to go on with our lives, and we know we can’t do that,” Dylan said. “We’ve tried. People just see us as pets and objects now, and they treat us like it. Sooner or later we’ll be captured by someone else.”

“So what are you going to do?” Brandon asked.

“Set out on our own again,” Clay said. “We were traveling on our own before, until a little boy caught us. We’ll go back to that way of life. It’s better than pretending we can live like we could before we shrank.”

“Plus we’ll have each other,” Dylan said, throwing his arm around Clay.

Brandon stared at the pair of toned, athletic shrunken teens. A few weeks ago, he might have been disgusted at their relationship, but now, after Alec...

“So you’re just going to take your chances in the wild?” Brandon questioned.

“Yep,” Clay and Dylan said in unison.

Brandon kept looking at the pair of them, then over at Dakota, who had sat down and looked ready to cry. His heart went out to all three of them, but he did not know what to do.

“What about you?” Brandon asked Alec.

“I’m staying with you, at least for a while, remember?” Alec said.

“Your mom didn’t like that.’

“Yeah but I convinced her, eventually.”

“Hmm,” Brandon said, smiling at Alec, who grinned in response.

He studied Clay, Dylan, and young Dakota yet again. He really had no idea how to help them. He did not want to let Clay and Dylan venture out on their own again, but he could not afford to take care of them or Dakota. It would be difficult enough convincing his parents to let him keep Alec. Shrinkies did not eat much, but they would need clothes, and eventually they would rack up medical costs just like regular people.

Suddenly he remembered Professor Setherton, and how his Shrinkies always disappeared every year. What did he do with them anyway? Surely he did not kill them. Did he sell them to people? Surely the teaching assistants would not be so eager to volunteer in his class if they could simply buy his Shrinky from him at the end of the semester.

Brandon picked his cell phone up off his desk.

“Hang on guys, I need to make a phone call.”

….........

After talking with one of his professors, he hung up.

He spun his chair around so that he faced his computer desk and the Shrinkies standing on top of it again.

“What the hell are you doing?” Dylan called across the room.

“I’ve got an idea, boys!” Brandon said.

1121111111111111111111111111.content:
Based on the story, Dakota and Wendi: Getting Shrinky With It, by huzshrink (or Huz for short.), this story follows the aftermath of the Shrunken Boy Chronicles.
To see more of Huz's brilliant work, follow the link:
http://huzshrink.deviantart.com/
Contents from his story used in this interactive story are being used with permission from the author, Huz.

Dakota sat and stared thoughtfully at the carpeted floor. Ever confident in himself, Bryan refused to even think about failing.

"Okay New Guy, there it is," said Jacob. The twelve-year-old adjusted his baseball cap on his head and pointed to the corner of the lush green backyard.

Bryan was surprised and disappointed to see a large tire lying in the grass. When Devin and his friends first told him about this 'trial' that every kid who was new to the town had to complete to be part of Devin's group, Bryan had been expecting something frightening and dangerous.

"It's a tire," Bryan said.

"Yes genius, it is," Troy said. His impish face smirked.

"You're not going to pansy out on us, are you?" Devin asked, folding his arms. He, Troy and Bryan were all fourteen, but Devin was the tallest out of all of them by far. He was a star basketball player for the school's high school team. With his handsome face and cocky attitude, every girl in school wanted to be his girlfriend. This made Bryan jealous of him. It also made him eager to prove himself to the taller boy.

"It's a tire," Bryan said again.

"Stand in it," Troy said, still smirking. "You'll see."

Puzzled and annoyed, Bryan walked toward the tire. He lifted his foot to step inside it.

"Wait," Devin said, holding out his hand. "Your shoes. Take them off."

Bryan glared at him in confusion, but obeyed, slipping off his flip-flops and setting them outside the tire. The grass inside the tire was cool and moist against his bare feet.

"Okay… Now what?" Bryan asked.

But there was nowhere to go to escape the light: it had formed a circular wall of light around Bryan. He could no longer see the other boys.

"Hey! What's going on!" he shouted.

Seconds later, the yellow light vanished.

"What the hell was that?" Bryan asked the three other boys. Devin's, Jacob's and Troy's expressions hadn't changed at all. Unnerved by this, Bryan persisted: "Guys? Hello?"

info.description:
None of America's medical experts predicted the arrival of a genetic mutation known as the Shrinking Gene. When hundreds of adolescents began mysteriously shrinking to approximately six inches tall, people all across the United States, and even throughout the rest of the world, panicked. For almost a year there were mass riots occurring every day. The President of the United States and Congress frantically mobilized the world's top doctors to find a cure. Their allies in the U.K., France, Russia, and other countries also aided them in this search for a remedy to the mass shrinking of so many teenagers, but the epidemic remained entirely contained within the borders of the U.S. This is what finally led scientists and doctors to agree that this uncanny transformation was not being caused by a virus or bacteria, but by a complex genetic mutation. After three years, world leaders conceded that there was no cure. Scientists dubbed this mutation the Shrinking Syndrome. Oddly enough, society adjusted itself fairly well after that.

Only one in a thousand people actually developed this mutation, and it always revealed itself in the years during puberty, before the age of twenty. Thus, anyone twenty and older counted themselves fortunate and went on with their lives.

As for those teens who were not so fortunate and who suddenly found themselves rapidly shrinking one day, they found that, although some public officials were doing their best to accommodate them, most people considered them as something less-than-human, more like pets or toys than actual people. Some law officials were doing their best to prosecute those that harmed or mistreated Shrinkies, but the cases were so numerous, with even more unreported, that the task soon proved impossible.
